titles.*: Being a Product Engineer at Wise

en: Join us for an exclusive peek into the world of product engineering at Wise. Our Engineering Lead Daniel Arruda Santos Anjos will take the stage to unravel the mysteries and unveil the essence of being a product engineer. Get ready to delve into firsthand experiences straight from our speaker, as we decode the journey of engineering excellence at Wise.

titles.*: Breaking Chains: Confronting Common Productivity Hurdles in Modern Software Development

en: Having had the opportunity to work with various organizations and teams on software projects in recent years, I've realized that many teams blindly follow established best practices or technologies without realizing that some of them can actually hinder productivity, causing delays in meeting project deadlines and diminishing developer satisfaction. Often, developers or managers, stressed by impending deadlines, worsen their situation by adopting even more inefficient practices or intentionally accruing technical debt, further complicating their circumstances.

In this talk, I'll explain why some popular practices might not be as effective as commonly believed, highlighting the actual problems they solve and the specific situations in which they could be beneficial. These examples draw from my 20+ years of experience and the recognition of my company, Codeborne, as one of the more quick and efficient software development partners.

Let's reconsider how teams can work more enjoyably and efficiently, minimizing wasted time. The goal is to illustrate that there are alternative, more effective ways to develop software and to give you ideas to make better choices when initiating a new project or improving your current practices.

Software can be developed and delivered in multitude of ways. Waterfall and agile both have their places in software world. There is, however, one thing in common in development processes when we look at great software (and delivery efficiency): these teams or companies have great leaders.

I'll explore the idea that a great leader doesn't have to have a title to lead. We can create the leadership within a team to move closer to engineering driven development in order to deliver great software faster.

titles.*: How to test an FPV drone

en: Many have seen how FPV drones work, but just as many have not delved into the topic of what they are made of and how they are tested. In my presentation, I will talk about how it all works and how the testing process takes place. This topic is very interesting because it involves the intersection of both hardware and software components.

titles.*: Running a private cloud - the good, the bad and the ugly!

en: A brief introduction to Playtech private cloud solution. How it came to be, what are the challenges and how we manage it.
How to solve typical problems: enabling debug logs, setting breakpoints, reading thread dumps, resolving dependencies, and so on.
Seemingly basic things, but many people don't know or use all of this.
Erik will further elaborate on Codeborne's ongoing journey with eXtreme Programming.

Imagine the scenario of countless startups that secure substantial investments only to squander them on expensive hires and extravagant resources without much thought. These companies, lured by the promise of rapid growth and success, fail to assess the long-term consequences of their spending choices. As a result, they find themselves grappling with bloated budgets, inefficient processes, and limited runway to sustain their operations, not to mention laying off the staff, they were so eager to hire.
Welcome to Frugal Software Architecure: a set of principles to balance strategic investments and cost optimizations to achieve big goals.

Get ready to dive into the age-old tech debate – monoliths or microservices – with a twist! Our speaker, Dmytro Hnatiuk from Wise, is about to take us on a journey through the services that power Wise's world. Ever wondered how scaling impacts the services we rely on? Dmytro's got the scoop. He'll chat about what stays, what changes, and what's on the horizon as Wise keeps growing.

titles.*: Powering ChatGPT with your own data

en: An AI chatbot like ChatGPT can not answer questions about unfamiliar topics, recent events after 2021, or non-public documents. This task gets even more complicated when you deal with data that constantly changes. What should you do?

This presentation showcases a solution to these hurdles. You will learn how to build your AI app and how language models such as those provided by OpenAI (Embeddings) and Pathway Python libraries can query real-time data intelligently without vector databases. This method opens up the potential to build solid systems for retrieving information, recommending content, or even making chatbots that answer user questions based on ever-changing streaming data.
